title: Understanding EFL Learners' Code-Switching and Teachers' Pedagogical Approaches in LLM-Supported Speaking Practice
summary: For English as a Foreign Language (EFL) learners, code-switching (CSW), or alternating between their native language and the target language (English), can lower anxiety and ease communication barriers. Large language models (LLMs), with their multilingual abilities, offer new opportunities to support CSW in speaking practice. Yet, the pedagogical design of LLM-based tutors remains underexplored.
